channel.title: The need for a more universal client
channel.description:
There are many servers and clients out there, and I find it a very difficult task to find a base which I can work on without having premade subjective features which do not corrolate the original runescape design.
With the recent Jagex changes, many players are seeking refuge in private servers, and when I think private servers, I think moparscape.
The sad thing is, I could never really navigate this site, nor find any sources, nor reliable high-uptime servers.
At the current moment, there is a need for a more universal runescape private server that is at least somewhat reliable enough for players to play instead of runescape.
Runescape is changing is a very drastic direction, and private servers have the upper hand in this matter. The question is -- why has no server pushed to gain attention of runescape players yet? Many players would switch in seconds.
Thanks!

item.title: The need for a more universal client
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

the moparscape client is highly universal and completely open to development.

Read full topic

item.title: The need for a more universal client
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

The idea is impractical. The total collective will of all the developers who have a shot at making such a thing is very low and the development time for such a project would take months. Not worth it.

Read full topic
item.source: The need for a more universal client

item.title: The need for a more universal client
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

I’ve been working on mine for sime time. Maybe I’ll release some code in the future.

Read full topic
item.source: The need for a more universal client

item.title: The need for a more universal client
item.dc:creator: @frozon566 frozon566
item.description:
@frozon566 wrote:

well people have written good frameworks but no one has applied them, people just keep trying to reinvent the wheel, the development section is proof of that with all the ruunescape2006/7 remakes.

essentially i think it just comes down to people,

  1. being to young to implement anything successfully
  2. not wanting to spend the ammount of time that would be needed to write an even somewhat universal server/client.

and even then people would just start releasing tutorials and messing it up, release “updated versions” under there own revision name and then the process would restart.

Read full topic

and then we would

rage like they do on COD

item.title: The need for a more universal client
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

Because 95% of the people that work on them are 15, those who play are like 12 (this is just averages). If you fire one of the developers, they’ll more than likely leak the source and rage like they do on COD all day.

Also, no one can be asked to put time into this. There would be so much needing to be done, it would take forever. We aren’t talking about ub3r hax0r leet coders like the people at Linux or Microsoft, we talking about kids who managed to learn the basics of Java.

Read full topic
